Enable the widget frame on the lockscreen.
Make the background of the widget frame opaque, so transparent widgets can overlay lock screen elements.
Hide the widget frame while there are notifications being shown. This requires the use of a Notification Listener Service. You don\'t have to grant this permission right now.
Lockscreen Widgets is a simple app with a simple purpose: to bring back Android KitKat\'s lock screen widgets. Your widgets will show up in a simple paged slider on the lockscreen.

All interaction with Lockscreen Widgets happens straight from the lock screen. It\'s where you add and remove widgets, and also where you adjust the position and size of the widget frame itself. Tap the \"plus\" page to add a widget; press and hold to reorder widgets in the list; and tap anywhere on the frame with two fingers to move/resize the frame or remove the current widget.
To be able to display on the lock screen, you\'ll need to activate Lockscreen Widgets\' Accessibility Service. This app doesn\'t collect any data from your screen.
Lockscreen Widgets can hide the widget frame while there are notifications displayed. To do so, you\'ll need to enable the Notification Listener.
That\'s it! Check your lock screen and you should now see the widget frame!
